themes became the  basis for  a  series  of  memos,  with each

This process resulted in
76 papers being included in our review.

We  excluded  papers  where  the  keyword
“reflection”  was  used  to  refer  to  the  optical  phenomenon,
e.g.,  “frustrated  total  internal  reflection”  as  a  technique  in
touch-based  interfaces.

We  also  excluded  papers  that  were
reflections on the field of HCI where the  authors were the
primary people doing the reflecting.

informatics  systems  pose  new  interesting  HCI  challenges. We believe that the stage-based model, the identification of

properties  of  the  stages  will  help  HCI  researchers  and 
practitioners  find  solutions  and  explore  new  approaches  in 
personal informatics more efficiently.
